alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 4:46AM EDT until April 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne affecting Bucks County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neshaminy Creek At Langhorne. * WHEN...From early this morning to this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the lowest banks, on both sides of the creek, into adjacent wooded areas. At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins on Bridle Drive in Middletown Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 9.4 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 12/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Neshaminy Creek Langhorne 9.0 8.2 Tue 4 am 4.2 3.0 9.4 8am 4/19 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM EDT.
